intro: Minuartia geniculata f. villosissima, commonly known as the hairy rock-cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. Its leaves are usually linear or oblanceolate, with a distinctive hairy texture that gives it its common name. This subspecies is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments and is often seen in alpine or coastal regions.
